verses.text: Paul, an apostle (not from men nor through man, but through Jesus Christ and God the Father who raised Him from the dead), and all the brethren who are with me,

verses.text: I marvel that you are turning away so soon from Him who called you in the grace of Christ, to a different gospel, which is not another; but there are some who trouble you and want to pervert the gospel of Christ.
parts: I marvel that you are turning away so soon from Him who called you in the grace of Christ, to a different gospel,
which is not another; but there are some who trouble you and want to pervert the gospel of Christ.

verses.text: which is not another; but there are some who trouble you and want to pervert the gospel of Christ.

verses.text: But even if we, or an angel from heaven, preach any other gospel to you than what we have preached to you, let him be accursed.
parts: But even if we, or an angel from heaven, preach any other gospel to you than what we have preached to you, let him be accursed.

verses.text: As we have said before, so now I say again, if anyone preaches any other gospel to you than what you have received, let him be accursed.
parts: As we have said before, so now I say again, if anyone preaches any other gospel to you than what you have received, let him be accursed.

verses.text: For do I now persuade men, or God?
parts: For do I now persuade men, or God?

verses.text: But I make known to you, brethren, that the gospel which was preached by me is not according to man. For I neither received it from man, nor was I taught it, but it came through the revelation of Jesus Christ.

verses.text: For you have heard of my former conduct in Judaism, how I persecuted the church of God beyond measure and tried to destroy it. And I advanced in Judaism beyond many of my contemporaries in my own nation, being more exceedingly zealous for the traditions of my fathers.

verses.text: But when it pleased God, who separated me from my mother's womb and called me through His grace, to reveal His Son in me, that I might preach Him among the Gentiles, I did not immediately confer with flesh and blood, nor did I go up to Jerusalem to those who were apostles before me; but I went to Arabia, and returned again to Damascus.

verses.text: Then after fourteen years I went up again to Jerusalem with Barnabas, and also took Titus with me. And I went up by revelation, and communicated to them that gospel which I preach among the Gentiles, but privately to those who were of reputation, lest by any means I might run, or had run, in vain. Yet not even Titus who was with me, being a Greek, was compelled to be circumcised.

verses.text: But from those who seemed to be something—whatever they were, it makes no difference to me; God shows personal favoritism to no man—for those who seemed to be something added nothing to me. But on the contrary, when they saw that the gospel for the uncircumcised had been committed to me, as the gospel for the circumcised was to Peter (for He who worked effectively in Peter for the apostleship to the circumcised also worked effectively in me toward the Gentiles), and when James, Cephas, and John, who seemed to be pillars, perceived the grace that had been given to me, they gave me and Barnabas the right hand of fellowship, that we should go to the Gentiles and they to the circumcised .

Now when Peter a had come to Antioch, I withstood him to his face, because he was to be blamed; for before certain men came from James, he would eat with the Gentiles; but when they came, he withdrew and separated himself, fearing those who were of the circumcision. And the rest of the Jews also played the hypocrite with him, so that even Barnabas was carried away with their hypocrisy.

had come to Antioch, I withstood him to his face, because he was to be blamed;

verses.text: But when I saw that they were not straightforward about the truth of the gospel, I said to Peter before them all, “If you, being a Jew, live in the manner of Gentiles and not as the Jews, why do you a compel Gentiles to live as Jews? b We who are Jews by nature, and not sinners of the Gentiles, knowing that a man is not justified by the works of the law but by faith in Jesus Christ, even we have believed in Christ Jesus, that we might be justified by faith in Christ and not by the works of the law; for by the works of the law no flesh shall be justified.
parts: But when I saw that they were not straightforward about the truth of the gospel, I said to Peter before

verses.text: Now the works of the flesh are evident, which are: adultery, a fornication, uncleanness, lewdness, idolatry, sorcery, hatred, contentions, jealousies, outbursts of wrath, selfish ambitions, dissensions, heresies, envy, murders, a drunkenness, revelries, and the like; of which I tell you beforehand, just as I also told you in time past, that those who practice such things will not inherit the kingdom of God.

in time past, that those who practice such things will not inherit the kingdom of God.

verses.text: But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, longsuffering, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness, self-control.
parts: But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, longsuffering, kindness, goodness, faithfulness,
gentleness, self-control.

verses.text: gentleness, self-control.
parts: gentleness, self-control.

verses.text: And those who are
parts: And those

verses.text: If we live in the Spirit, let us also walk in the Spirit.
parts: If we live in the Spirit, let us also walk in the Spirit.

verses.text: Let us not become conceited, provoking one another, envying one another.
parts: Let us not become conceited, provoking one another, envying one another.

verses.text: Brethren, if a man is overtaken in any trespass, you who are spiritual restore such a one in a spirit of gentleness, considering yourself lest you also be tempted. Bear one another's burdens, and so fulfill the law of Christ. For if anyone thinks himself to be something, when he is nothing, he deceives himself.
parts: Brethren, if a man is overtaken in any trespass, you who
spiritual restore such a one in a spirit of gentleness, considering yourself lest you also be tempted.
Bear one another's burdens, and so fulfill the law of Christ.
For if anyone thinks himself to be something, when he is nothing, he deceives himself.

verses.text: But let each one examine his own work, and then he will have rejoicing in himself alone, and not in another.
parts: But let each one examine his own work, and then he will have rejoicing in himself alone, and not in another.

verses.text: For each one shall bear his own load.
parts: For each one shall bear his own load.

verses.text: Let him who is taught the word share in all good things with him who teaches.
parts: Let him who is taught the word share in all good things with him who teaches.

verses.text: Do not be deceived, God is not mocked; for whatever a man sows, that he will also reap.
parts: Do not be deceived, God is not mocked; for whatever a man sows, that he will also reap.

verses.text: For he who sows to his flesh will of the flesh reap corruption, but he who sows to the Spirit will of the Spirit reap everlasting life.
parts: For he who sows to his flesh will of the flesh reap corruption, but he who sows to the Spirit will of the Spirit reap everlasting life.

verses.text: And let us not grow weary while doing good, for in due season we shall reap if we do not lose heart.
parts: And let us not grow weary while doing good, for in due season we shall reap if we do not lose heart.

verses.text: Therefore, as we have opportunity, let us do good to all, especially to those who are of the household of faith.
parts: Therefore, as we have opportunity, let us do good to all, especially to those who are of the household of faith.

verses.text: See with what large letters I have written to you with my own hand!
parts: See with what large letters I have written to you with my own hand!

verses.text: As many as desire to make a good showing in the flesh, these would
parts: As many as desire to make a good showing in the flesh, these

verses.text: For not even those who are circumcised keep the law, but they desire to have you circumcised that they may boast in your flesh.
parts: For not even those who are circumcised keep the law, but they desire to have you circumcised that they may boast in your flesh.

verses.text: But God forbid that I should boast except in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, by whom a
parts: But God forbid that I should boast except in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, by whom

verses.text: For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision nor uncircumcision avails anything, but a new creation.
parts: For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision nor uncircumcision avails anything, but a new creation.

verses.text: And as many as walk according to this rule, peace and mercy be upon them, and upon the Israel of God.
parts: And as many as walk according to this rule, peace and mercy
upon them, and upon the Israel of God.

verses.text: From now on let no one trouble me, for I bear in my body the marks of the Lord Jesus.
parts: From now on let no one trouble me, for I bear in my body the marks of the Lord Jesus.

verses.text: Brethren, the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.
parts: Brethren, the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ
with your spirit.
